conclusion: To determine which container (E or F) liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles labeled A, B, C, and D, we need to analyze the flow direction and the path of the liquid as it passes through each baffle.
Baffle A: The liquid flows from left to right.
Baffle B: The liquid flows from top to bottom.
Baffle C: The liquid flows from right to left.
Baffle D: The liquid flows from bottom to top.

premise: Baffle A: The liquid flows from left to right.
conclusion: After Baffle A: The liquid moves horizontally from left to right.

premise: Baffle B: The liquid flows from top to bottom.
conclusion: After Baffle B: The liquid moves vertically from top to bottom.

premise: Baffle C: The liquid flows from right to left.
conclusion: After Baffle C: The liquid moves horizontally from right to left.

premise: Baffle D: The liquid flows from bottom to top.
conclusion: After Baffle D: The liquid moves vertically from bottom to top.

premise: After Baffle D: The liquid moves vertically from bottom to top.
conclusion: The liquid will exit Baffle D and move vertically upwards.

premise: The liquid will exit Baffle D and move vertically upwards.
conclusion: Since the liquid exits Baffle D and moves upwards, it will enter Container E.
